alert.note: Alert for Klamath Basin and the Fremont-Winema National Forest (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 10 at 1:24PM PDT until August 11 at 9:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: .Strong winds aloft will gradually mix downward to all elevations this afternoon and evening, and are likely to do so again Thursday. Gusty south to southwest winds combined with low RH and recent fire starts will lead to critical fire weather conditions Wednesday afternoon and evening and Thursday afternoon and evening in south central Oregon and northeast California. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM PDT THIS EVENING FOR STRONG GUSTY WIND WITH LOW RH FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 624... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM TO 9 PM PDT THURSDAY FOR STRONG GUSTY WIND WITH LOW RH FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 624... The National Weather Service in Medford has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from 2 PM to 9 PM PDT Thursday. * Impacts: Strong, gusty wind with low relative humidity and critically dry vegetation will greatly increase the spread potential of any new and existing fires. * Affected area: In South Central OR...Portions of Fire Weather Zone 624, including Bly, Bonanza, Sprague River, Lakeview, Valley Falls, and portions of the Fremont-Winema National Forest. * Wind: South 10 to 20 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * Humidity: As low as 8 percent. * View the hazard area in detail at: https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/mfr/HAZARD

area.areaDesc: Klamath Basin and the Fremont-Winema National Forest
